awd_titl_txt: Laser and Molecular Beam Apparatus for Undergraduate        Teaching Laboratory
awd_abstract_narration: A new physical chemistry laboratory course in quantum mechanics                 and statistical mechanics is using a laser and molecular beam                   apparatus to develop an intuitive understanding of concepts                     usually presented in the abstract. Experiments performed on                     ultracold molecules under the collisionless conditions present                  in a molecular beam allows students to more clearly see the                     applicability of pertinent models and theories.  More                           conventional experiments are pedagogically less effective                       because the phenomena of interest are obscured by                               intermolecular interactions and the wide range of states                        occupied by molecules in the sample.  The new equipment is also                 be used in an advanced spectroscopy and quantum mechanics                       laboratory course.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: PRESIDENT AND TRUSTEES OF BATES COLLEGE
